trans-unit.source: Provides data for the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataGrid.CancelCommand"></xref>, <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataGrid.DeleteCommand"></xref>, <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataGrid.EditCommand"></xref>, <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataGrid.ItemCommand"></xref>, and <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataGrid.UpdateCommand"></xref> events of the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataGrid"></xref> control.
This class cannot be inherited.
The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataGrid.CancelCommand> event is raised when the Cancel button for an item in the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataGrid> control is clicked.
The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataGrid.DeleteCommand> event is raised when the Delete button for an item in the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataGrid> control is clicked.
The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataGrid.EditCommand> event is raised when the Edit button for an item in the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataGrid> control is clicked.
The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataGrid.ItemCommand> event is raised when any button for an item in the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataGrid> control is clicked.
This allows you to programmatically test for when a specific command button is clicked and take appropriate action.
This event is commonly used to handle custom command buttons for the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataGrid> control.
The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataGrid.UpdateCommand> event is raised when the Update button for an item in the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataGrid> control is clicked.
For a list of initial property values for an instance of DataGridCommandEventArgs, see the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataGridCommandEventArgs.%23ctor%2A> constructor.
For more information about handling events, see [NIB: Events and Delegates](http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/d98fd58b-fa4f-4598-8378-addf4355a115).
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataGridCommandEventArgs"></xref> class.
Use this constructor to create and initialize a new instance of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataGridCommandEventArgs> class.
When an instance of <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataGridCommandEventArgs> is created by a call to this constructor, the following properties are initialized to the specified values.

|Property|Initial value| |--------------|-------------------| |<xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataGridCommandEventArgs.CommandSource%2A>|The value of the `commandSource` parameter.| |<xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataGridCommandEventArgs.Item%2A>|The value of the `item` parameter.|
A <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataGridItem"></xref> that represents the selected item in the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataGrid"></xref>.
The source of the command.
A <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.CommandEventArgs"></xref> that contains the event data.
Gets the source of the command.
Use the CommandSource property to determine the command source that raised the event.
This property is commonly used to determine which command raised the event.
The source of the command.
Gets the item containing the command source in the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataGrid"></xref> control.
The Item property is used to access the properties of the selected item in the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataGrid> control.
A <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataGridItem"></xref> that represents the selected item in the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataGrid"></xref> control.
